Name: Saul anointed as king; Samuel retires
Saul fights the Philistines at Gibeah
Saul fights the Amalekites; rejected by God
Genealogies
Description: not clear what to do with this

Name: David king over Judah; fighting with the house of Saul
David anointed king over Israel at Hebron
David defeats the Philisines in the Valley of Rephaim
David brings the Ark to Jerusalem; promise of the Temple
Nathan rebukes David; death of Bathsheba's child
David's preparations for the building of the Temple and organisation of worship
David names Solomon his successor; instructions to Solomon
Solomon establishes his kingdom, granted wisdom
Building of the Temple
Notes: See Finnegan S424 for exact 480  dating issue

Name: Jeroboam rebels against Solomon and flees to Egypt
Prophecy against Jeroboam by the man of Judah
Tibni
Description: Arguable whether he counts as a king

Name: Capital of Israel moved from Tirzah to Samaria
Elijah prophesies a drought; fed by ravens
Elijah and the prophets of Baal at Mount Carmel
Micaiah prophesies against Ahab; Ahab dies in battle at Ramoth Gilead
Description: Attested in Assyrian records as the battle of Qarqar, summer 853. See Finnegan S422

Name: Joram
Description: Also Jehoram in the Hebrew, but not to be confused with Jehoram of Judah

Name: Elijah taken up into heaven
Notes: Usher's estimate. Not even clear in which reign this happens!

Name: Elisha heals the water supply; Elisha jeered for being bald
Elisha performs various miracles including healing Naaman
Ben-Hadad of Aram murdered and succeeded by Hazael
Accession of Rehoboam and split of the kingdom
Prophecy by Azariah son of Oded and Asa's reforms
Asa at war with Baasha of Israel
Description: Dating issue here. Cannot be the 36th year of Asa's reign, since Baasha is dead. Usher proposed 36th year of the split kingdom, which I've followed, but need to check with other sources (Thiele preferably).

Name: Asa afflicted with a disease in his foot
Jehoshaphat appoints officials to teach the Law
Jehoshaphat marries his son Jehoram to Athaliah of Israel
Notes: Needs to be before 863 when their son is born!

Name: Jehoshaphat defeats the Moabites and Ammonites
Hezekiah reconsecrates the Temple and re-establishes Passover
Hezekiah receives messengers from Merodach-Baladan of Bablyon
Book of the Law found; renewal of the covenant
Capture of Jerusalem and beginning of Exile
Gedaliah murdered and the exile to Egypt
Isaiah
Description: Estimated dates that the prophet was active
Notes: IVP dates for these books. Need confirming

Name: Prophecy during the reign of Josiah
Vision of two baskets of figs
Prophecy of disaster but a return after 70 years
Symbol of the yoke, and Hananiah
Jeremiah buys a field; prophecy of destruction but later healing
A warning to Zedekiah that Jerusalem will fall
Jeremiah in prison and in a cistern
Jerusalem freed and the exile to Egypt
Prophecy against Egypt at the time of Carchemish
Prophecy about Emmanuel and Assyria
Description: It isn't clear where this prophecy ends, possibly as late as chapter 12.

Name: Psalms
Description: Dating the Psalms is in many cases difficult or impossible, and they seem to have been composed over a wide timeframe. Placed here given the large number written by David (and Asaph, his contemporary) and the traditional association with him.
